description.narrative: (i) Alleviation of Fuel Shortages and Meeting Demand Growth: IFC will support the largest fuel importer who is contributing to alleviation of fuel shortages. Given the empirical evidence of a high correlation between energy consumption and GDP growth and a direct relationship between the absence of adequate energy and many poverty indicators, the project has significant economic importance for the country. (ii) Deepening Ghanaian Financial Markets: The project supplements the facilities offered by local banks and IFC''s GTFP program through providing additional cost effective trade finance solutions in Ghana. (iii) Private Sector Development: The facility is supporting Ghanaian private sector companies in a recently deregulated and growing sector.

The proposed project involves the renewal of the existing Master Risk Participation Agreement (MRPA) with Standard Chartered Bank(SCB) for a trade facility of US$150 million for the issuance of Letters of Credit (LC) to a Ghanaian bulk distribution company (BDC) for the importation of petroleum products into Ghana for another 3 years starting from June 2013. The BDC under consideration is Chase Petroleum Ghana Limited (Chase). Of the total facility amount, IFCs exposure will be up to US$75 million through the risk sharing arrangement, whereby, IFC will effectively share the underlying credit risk of the BDC with SCB.
